page.title: 06DISUSED AIRFIELD
page.content: LANDSCAPE & BUILDINGS. Airfield (Disused) This is the way it is described on the Ordnance Survey Maps, in point of fact it is divided into 3 uses. The runway which runs from S.E. to N.W. is being used by Pocklington & District Gliding Club who also have small portion of land for a hanger and ops. office. The greater part of the airfield has reverted to its pre-war use,farming, the crops being both grass & root. The Farm House is still standing, it is occupied by a taxi owner. The rest of the airfield (old living quarters & hangers) are now an industrial estate, housing,car repairs,electrical-equipment & installers,Herbal & Health Foods & Cosmetics.Porto-cabins are made as are Breeze-blocks for dist. to the building trade.
